review.reviewBody: I have <100 miles on this at time of review, but I put it on a new-to-me gravel bike I'm trying to dial in before a Midwestern winter. Matched "roll pitch and yaw" roughly to my road bike saddle positioning and let 'er rip, I haven't noticed much in terms of a break-in period (but let me get a 100-miler in on 'er before I really can confirm that). Gel version is much more expensive, and I can't see why it would have been worth it for me personally.
review.name: Don't spring for the gel version

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable! Back Country was prompt in getting it out to me!
review.name: Love my new bicycle saddle!

review.reviewBody: At nearly 59, I wanted a saddle that was wider than my Terry men's Fly model, one I've had for twenty plus years. I've looked at a lot of saddles over the past couple of months, and one thing I'd recommend is going through the Selle SMP seat finder. This is the seat it picked for me. I have only been on a few short rides, but the fit feels excellent. I'm 6'0" and around 210. It's a few grams heavier than my Fly saddle, but also about 10mm wider, and I notice the small difference. I got the gray color and it is a pretty close match to my Mercury colored Trek.
review.name: Stellar Selle SMP Seat

name: VT30 C Saddle

review.reviewBody: I have had 3 back surgeries in 19 years of law enforcement. I researched these boots and eagerly waited for them to arrive. I put them on the next day they arrived. I ended up working 16.5 hours, 6 of which were directing traffic. I never would have made it without these boots. They are tremendously rejuvenating and allowed me to energetically make it through the long day.
review.name: I would buy them again.

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Hiking Boots (TenNine) on 3/7/24 and received the boots shortly thereafter. I hiked the Camino (Spain) in June for 30 days and ~500 miles. The shoes literally wore out. I went through the process of trying to return/exchange only to be dismissed by a bot on their customer service texto. I had asked for a person to person call from a supervisor and that went into a black hole. I have purchased +10 various Hoka's over the recent years and they now have lost a loyalist and brand advocate.
review.name: I would NEVER purchase this product again ! ! !

review.reviewBody: I own at least eight pairs of Hoka shoes and have struggled finding the right shoe for all day construction work. TENNINE HIKE GTX was the answer. Hands down the most plush and comfortable Hoka shoe I have ever worn. Highly recommended for those experiencing foot pain but must also continue to perform at the construction site.
review.name: Best Construction Work Boot

review.reviewBody: thank science engineering for the design of this heel and sole .. its weird looking.. but its amazing as far as its stabilization and dispersal of energy in each step on the heel .. its a true gem of modern science.. hats off to the makers.. I'm gonna buy a half dozen pair... as when there gone.. that's it..
review.name: helped rescue my heels that have a bruised like pain

review.reviewBody: I tested these shoes for long and hill hiking, but they were not comfortable enough. This is the first Hoka product that has disappointed me, not only in terms of comfort but also in appearance. The extra width in the sole is excessive. i have to return and replace this
review.name: No I wouldn't buy this product again

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect boots for going into a trail- dry or wet , the perfect companion to go out in the wild
review.name: Awesome! Dry terrains or mud

review.reviewBody: I tried both the Kaha and the TenNines. I need good cushioning because I have arthritis in my ankles from corrective surgery I had as a kid and I felt that these were a little more flat (heel to toe drop) than the Kahas. I also feel like they were more narrow than usual and I don't order wide shoe sizes. I could feel more ground in the soles and the dovetail heel almost forced your toes down as you moved forward which for me, made the front of my shins hurt. Now, I have a slightly weird gait because of my surgery, so it may not apply to everyone. I loved the unique look of them and they provided a wide base and good stability compared to the Kahas. Ultimately though I chose more comfort over super stability.
review.name: Good! But less cushioned than the Kaha's

review.reviewBody: They may look like something for a mission to Mars but there are the comfortable hiking boot I have from HOKA...and I have them all. Perfect for long walks or hikes on gravel or fire roads. I may want a hiking with a thinner cushion for scrambling or bouldering. As someone who has broken their back and shattered my left leg the TenNine boots provide the comfort for an ultra smooth ride.
review.name: Walking on a cloud

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a hiking trip, I walked 2 miles and developed plantar fasciitis in my left foot. They look great and feel light, but they destroyed my feet. I wear a size 13 in brooks and these 12.5 fit perfect.
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: I love Hokas but unfortunately I have wide feet and they have yet to make hiking boots that are waterproof in a wide size: (
review.name: Please make these in a wide version!!

name: Tennine GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Counter Assault 10.2oz Bear Deterrent Spray + Belt Holster online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 10.2oz Bear Deterrent Spray + Belt Holster
hasVariant.description: Buy the Counter Assault 10.2oz Bear Deterrent Spray + Belt Holster online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this Counter Assault Bear Deterrent since I live in a place where we sometimes have bears. If I'm outside at night I take this with me for protections. I would suggest practicing to shoot the spray before you get in a potential dangerous situation. That way, you know what you're doing and have no doubts. Great product for the price and high quality spray so you stay confident during a bear (or other dangerous animal) encounter!
review.name: Sure to scare the bears!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Bear Canister w/Holster Sealed Blister is possibly the most controlled bear repellent I have ever had. We have purchased similar products in the past as we like to camp a lot, and this one by far is the most functional. The mist is very fine, so be aware of the wind so you don't spray it where it can come back onto your face. It will happen. The sprayer is very precise. We did not have an encounter with a bear while having this product so we could not test it’s effectiveness, but considering the scent and ingredients, I know it will work. I would recommend this product to everyone who likes to go camping. Though bear encounters is not necessarily what we would hope for, it’s something to consider being prepared for. This product is an excellent option!
review.name: Bear Repel in style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Counter assault Bear deterrent is a must for hunters, people who live in wooded areas, and those who walk around less populated areas. I live in a somewhat wooded area, and we have had a lot of bear sightings lately. They are looking for food and coming right into neighborhoods to do so. We had one walk right past our front door the other morning. This includes a holster, which makes it easier to bring along on walks. Easy one handed operation.
review.name: Bears are everywhere.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We have been having a bear come into our yard and getting into the garbage and bird feeders. I used the 10.2 oz. Bear Canister w/Holster to really scare her away. It worked she hasent been back since. I like that the canister with holster attaches right to my hip. I just brought one for my grandmother,  she has had beers on her property and she is afraid to go outside at dusk.  I highly recommend the Bear Canister for anybody who owns property, hikers, hunters,  gardeners etc.
review.name: Great Features

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought the canaster a week ago !! Wow I'm very impressed by the size how easy to read instructions are , easy to put on my holster and go !!.. I bought this for the reasoning of bear sightings in the walkways of the place I go fishing you can never be more prepared !. This is by far a great product everyone should own !!.
review.name: Great Quality !!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This looks like it “could” work, I haven’t had to try it and not sure when I could use it but you never know.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Well I haven't ran into any bears "yet" but I hike and fish all the time and I tell you what I feel alot safer having it I like that it has a holster for easy access that way I'm not fumbling through my pack it's right there at the ready. The safety features keeps it from getting snagged on brush and other things causing accidental discharge
review.name: Great defense

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Although I have not needed to use it, I am confident that this product will deter a bear if we were to come into contact with it. It is from a reputable and recommended brand which gives me peace of mind as we take long hikes and go camping various times during the year. The instructions, along with the images provided, are very clear yet I plan on acquiring Counter Assault training as I want to be confident with the use of this product. This canister is designed for one-hand operation. Yet the enclosed holster would make that less possible if attached to a belt; it is snug and you would need to pull on the holster to remove the canister with the other hand. As a result, I attached the holster to my backpack as I can quickly unclip it and only detach the Velcro top off the holster from the actuator handle. There would be no need to remove holster this way and which would save crucial time. It is reassuring the distance that the spray covers. Another plus is the glow-in-the-dark safety clip to quickly operate in the dark! It appears to be a one-time use as the canister empties in 8 seconds. I hope to never have to use it but glad I carry it in case!
review.name: Peace of mind when hiking, biking and camping.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fortunately we have not needed to use this yet, which is a good thing. Right? I got this for my son who moved to Colorado this month just in case he came in contact with any bear's since he will be camping full time. It definitely gives me piece of mind knowing he has it with him. The canister is a great size, easy to carry with you which I really like. The people he has met have also said it's a great thing to have if you are going to be hiking, etc by yourself so that is reassuring. If nothing else, this has given this Momma Bear a sense of relief knowing he has this with him all the time which is priceless. I hope he is never out in a position to have to use it, but if so it's great to know he has it. What's the old saying? Better to have and not need than to need and not have!
review.name: Great to have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't sprayed anything with it, and hope I don't have to. I like the spraying distance, and size. The bear in our area have little fear of humans, so this will be handy for potential danger or, attack.
review.name: Bear spray

name: 10.2oz Bear Deterrent Spray + Belt Holster

review.reviewBody: these shoes look great, feel great, and are very solid. I get tons of compliments on them too. I wear them as everyday shoes and will buy them again

review.reviewBody: Excellent Approach Shoe, it is very sturdy. Not very light and does not have an excellent attachment point to climb with. Gonna have to pack it.
review.name: Great Approach Shoe

review.reviewBody: incredible dexterity and functionality. The engineering of this shoe is truly a  cut above the others
review.name: amazing

review.reviewBody: Second pair of these.... the old ones are still kicking after 3-years but wanted a new pair. Rock solid shoes.

This is my 3rd pair of these shoes. I've almost worn out 1 pair, and wanted these in the brighter color. Soft feel, great traction, good for hiking and scrambling.  Like how they can loosen or tighten around the forefoot and also snug in the heel. They're a little heavier and sturdier than the Pedroc Air.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: I actually work on them, I have 0 fatigue when I take them off at the end of a day, same when hiking, but that is with the thru and trekking shoes. I have about 6 pairs of Salewa's and these are my favorite for sure.wildfires are nice
review.name: Get you some

review.reviewBody: Have hiked a total of 30 miles in these and very happy. I usually use orthotics in my other shoes, but no need with these as they provide great arch support. Love the toe protection they provide as well.
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: Excellent choice, I love it.
review.name: Comfortable, durable and beautiful!

review.reviewBody: Love the wildfire series of approach shoes and this is no different.  Bomber shoes that are comfy from the get go !
review.name: Great salewa

review.reviewBody: Recovering from ankle surgery, I needed shoes which would provide fail-safe stability and lateral motion support.  Tried several brands, but the instant I slipped these on, I knew I had hit the jackpot!  The more I wear them, the more I like them.  Problem is, they are so flashy; I can't wear them in business or downtown venues.  So, I just bought a second pair in all black, the GTX model.  Problem solved.  I am now a huge Salewa fan!
review.name: From Specialty To Everyday

name: Wildfire Edge Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Viaje Range Edition Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I truly hope I can do these boots justice. The V3 UltraCush liner shines through. I've taken these out split boarding five times and can honestly say these are incredibly comfy out of the box and worth the hype. The extra support from the Powercuff Strap is such a great addition for the uphill climb. I've had no hot spots. I used to not be a big fan of BOA about five years ago, but wow, have these boots won me over! So incredibly easy to use and adjust for the right fit. 

The first few times you use them, I would recommend tightening them as much as you need to zip up the waterproof 'zipper shroud.' Loosen them back up and then tighten for the right fit.

In the spirit of Hana Beaman, these boots paired with the RIDE Psychocandy on a deep pow day—chef's kiss.I would describe my foot as average, narrow at the heel, wider at the toes, with a moderate arch. I wear a true 7.5 in these. This is the same for the Nitro boots I wear on park days.
review.name: My favorite find for the 24-25 season

name: Viaje Range Edition Snowboard Boot - 2025 - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bought this less than three weeks ago and have been tested by very cold days in the Northeast. What a great jacket. It's extremely warm with merely a heavyweight base layer or flannel shirt beneath. The jacket fits snug around the body and keeps in the heat. It's lightweight and smooth to the touch. The hood is excellent. I just wish there were more pockets,,,no inside pockets at all. But otherwise I'm very satisfied with this purchase.
review.name: A Fine Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Very functional and technical. Every detail considered to make this a pro level jacket. 
Looks and feels very premium. Although specified as a regular fit, it fits quite snug but in a good way because of its professional nature.
One unavoidable aspect of a down jacket is that some down and feathers do leak at the seams. If you are a very peculiar person, be prepared for this battle.
review.name: Very functional and technical. Every

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, good fit and style..pity no chest pocket...time will tell over the winter months on warmth.
review.name: Lightweight, good fit and style..pity

review.reviewBody: Seems like a nice down jacket, but it was clearly too small based on the suggestion that it was sizes to layer over base layers.  Go one size up if you intend to have anything but a single layer underneath.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: Bought for a week long trip to the bugaboos. I was missing a mid weight jacket between my lighter down jacket and heavier belay parka. This jacket is excellent and is quite warm for the weight. I used it for two open air bivys along with my 45 degree sleeping bag in the bugaboos at 10,500 feet and was plenty warm. Will definitely continue to be packed for future adventures. Oh and I ordered the red and really like the color.
review.name: Love this jacket so far

review.reviewBody: Looks great, fits is great, lightweight, and warm; I'm very pleased with the jacket.
review.name: Looks great, fits is great,

review.reviewBody: Since it’s summer, tough to give true review as I’m not wearing it a lot.  Fit is great.  Cuffs are amazing. Only challenge so far is bottom zipper comes up when jacket is zipped.  But the couple times I’ve used it… it’s been good.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: Well made, great looking jacket. Bringing it with me to Nepal next week for the Mt. Everest Base Camp trek. Sizing is smaller than North Face or Patagonia.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: What can I say , Rab as produce a wonderful quality Men’s , which is worth all the money!!!!!
review.name: Quality jacket

review.reviewBody: Brilliant coat really pleased with the quality it’s lovely and warm.
review.name: Brilliant coat really pleased with

hasVariant.name: Aggressor EXO/TR 29in Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Maxxis Aggressor EXO/TR 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've run this tire many times on the rear of my bike. Does everything well without a huge weight penalty and has reasonable rolling resistance. This tire might wear a bit fast in the desert southwest where I ride, but it also wears more evenly than some other Maxxis tires.
review.name: Probably my favorite rear tire

review.reviewBody: I’ve ridden these for a season (~750 miles) on a variety of terrains including loamy single track, hardpack, rock and sandstone/slab, loose and rocky, and chunky, loose flint. These have been one of the best all-around tires I’ve ever used. If you ride any single style of terrain most of your outings, you can likely get a better tire combo to serve a specific use. If you’re like me and travel regionally to ride, consider these. I use them on a 130mm travel f/r trail bike and the 2.5” size adds a touch of cushion to chattery trails without being wildly speed-resistant. Not the fastest or grippiest tire but great for general trail use. I’ve never had a bad puncture, flat, or blowout either although that’s probably some luck. Overall, consider these if you mostly ride general terrain and need something for varying conditions. The only poor performance I had from these was in muddy conditions. 8.5/10.
review.name: Great front/rear all-around combo.

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this tire except how easily it has been to blow a side wall.   Not sure what it is or why its happening consistently as I havent experienced that on previous Maxxis.  Riding 3-4 days per week in Park City versus hard desert riding.
review.name: Great tire - consistent sidewall blowout

name: Aggressor EXO/TR 29in Tire

review.itemreviewed: Summit Torre Egger FUTURELIGHT Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use this for a variety of outdoor activities, ranging from skiing to hiking and camping, but also for basic things like shoveling snow or dropping the kids off at school. The jacket is surprisingly warm given that it's a simple shell (I've skied a few times with nothing more than a t-shirt underneath and been completely comfortable). Reasonably lightweight, and the fabric feels relatively durable. Pit zips were a must for me; these work well but aren't quite single handed operation. The chest pocket fits a phone nicely, and I appreciate the small elastic pocket insert inside the R lower pocket to hold a key separate from other items. The front zipper bunches quite a bit. Not so much an issue when you're upright, but kind of a nuisance when you sit (on a chairlift, when driving, etc.). The lack of a hanging tab inside the jacket is perplexing; I definitely don't like having to hang it by the hood but that's the only option.
review.name: Jacket holds promise, but needs some revisions

review.itemreviewed: Summit Torre Egger FUTURELIGHT Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: The future light material is extremely poor quality and cannot withstand half a season of skiing. I carried my skis a couple of times and the sleeves on the shell ripped. The bib shell ripped from the ski boots. I contacted North Face and they refused to take responsibility for the poor quality of their apparently high end product. My old goretex jacket has 0 rips and is 8 years old. This material will be the downfall of Northface
review.name: Will not last

review.itemreviewed: Summit Torre Egger FUTURELIGHT Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: If you carry your skis once it will rip the jacket.

description: Buy the Shimano XTR BB94 Bottom Bracket online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: XTR BB94 Bottom Bracket
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano XTR BB94 Bottom Bracket online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This and any other level 3 bearing bottom bracket will work but is is extremely basic and ads quite a bit of friction to your drive train.  The level 5 bearing bottom brackets, for just a few dollars more are so much better.  This one works, perfectly but you do so much more work for the same effort it is truly sad.  If all you have is $40 bucks, this one works as good as any low end, super basic bottom bracket but you will pay for this choice in hard work.  I hope this helps a lot of you decide without spending money on a product that is just too old school for even casual riding by todays standards.  It works and is smooth, just a lot of friction.  Install it, take off your chain and spin your crankset, you will see 3 revolutions.  Replace it with a slightly better, level 5 bb bracket and experience 12-15 revolutions with the same effort.  WOW is right.  Good quality, and its resistance doesn't get better after it breaks in.  Technology is too old for today, maybe a new rider can't tell the difference or good if you just take short rides.
review.name: You get what you pay for

name: XTR BB94 Bottom Bracket

review.reviewBody: I wish it had the little fabric loop in the front like my old one so I could attach the SUP leash there.  Other than that, I like it for SUP - low profile front to make it easy to get back on my board, arms are free - no chaffing when racing, good flotation.
review.name: RINGO

review.reviewBody: I bought this for whitewater, big water, and touring. The fit is spot on, the adjust-ability is super confidence inspiring when considering the multiple points of adjustment and the way I can snug it right up, or select where I want it tight and where I don't. There's no impingement when paddling. When I paddle I usually go 3-4 hours non-stop. No issues with this PFD. As with all Astral products the quality is obvious. Yes, you pay a good price, but your bacon may be on the line, so, where would you cut corners? Not here for me, I go in the drink, I come home, wet yes, but home. Go for it, you won't regret it.
review.name: Awesome PFD

review.reviewBody:
Great fit for me, and I like how low-profile the front of this jacket is.

Only nitpick is that the zipper likes to work its way down throughout the day.  I clipped the zipper head off on my last Ringo, and removing that tiny amount of weight solved that problem.  Well -- right up until I went to float the Grand Canyon and my Ringo would then not pass the inspection.
review.name: So close.

review.reviewBody: Got love that little flower. Rock solid vest for rafting with old school style. If you know...you know.
review.name: Lotu$.... I mean Astral Ringo.

review.reviewBody: Everyday jacket.  Love sustainable fill.  Perfect fit.  Front pocket perfect for phone or radio.  I have two - one for each boat (sometimes in different locations.
review.name: Everyday Comfort

review.reviewBody: Wore my Ringo for six days on the Middle Fork of the Salmon. Comfy and quickly adjustable. Quick in and out thanks to the zipper. The front pocket held my iPhone securely (in a dry bag) through all the whitewater. This PFD will get much more use.
review.name: Maiden voyage

review.reviewBody: Best life jacket I have ever owned, it does not limit your mobility and is comfortable to be in all day long. I have taken it on multiple river trips this season as well as regular river days, no issues so far. The pocket on the front has multiple sections so you can hold all of your necessities, as well as being the perfect size to hold the canned beverage of your choice!
review.name: Best life jacket I have ever owned.

review.reviewBody:
As we know, Astral PFD owns the Lotus PFD brand image and the Ringo personifies this. It looks great and has the Lotus emblem classically placed on the back.

The PFD itself fits greats and the idea is that is "holds on" to you below the rib-cage. The fabric feels good and the buoyancy is a good "in between". It wont save you if you are knocked out, but it wont hinder you.

I was surprised that Backcountry had this item in stock and I will be using backcountry in the future. Every other online store and brick-and-mortar were sold out of this item. Purchasing the product was simple and it was delivered within 2 days. Excellent service all around.

Highly recommend the Astral Ringo PFD and Backcountry
review.name: Pro PFD, all around
comment:
Thanks for the great review John.  Astral is a direct descendant of Lotus and the passion has never waivered to make the best products while considering nature first.  I appreciate your noting the connection, as well as Backcountry's efforts to keep up with the demand so their customers can find what they need for all of their paddling adventures.  I can tell you first hand it takes a great team and a lot of hustle.  

SYOTR
Mark - Astral Rep

review.reviewBody: I have a Palm Rescue PFD that I really like. It is, however, a bit bulky. When I saw the Ringo and its side Zipper, I decided to give it a chance. My Palm has 4 little pockets in which I store my knife, ear plugs, whistle and so on. Unfortunately, I can never remember what is where. The Ringo has one pocket with multiple compartments. Moreover, I don't have to latch my carabiner to anything, I just store it under the front pocket. Easy to get to and not in the way when getting ready to go out. Finding my stuff is easy. The key to this PFD, however, is the comfort level. It is not as bulky as my Palm and, therefore, much more comfortable. I barely know that it is on!
review.name: I love the Ringo!

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this PFD to replace my aging Green Jacket, which is also a fantastic PFD. What drew me to the Ringo was the lighter weight, and the front entry, while still being rescue harness compatible. While the added safety and rescue features of the Green Jacket are great when needed, they do add weight, and in my case, I just need the tether capability. The Ringo is light, fit is very comfortable and easily adjustable. I did add a harness, which is easy, and very well integrated (and also very easy to remove on days that I don't need it). Great PFD, highly recommended!
review.name: Great PFD!

name: Ringo Personal Floatation Device - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Just received my fourth pair of Enduro Shorts.
They fit as expected and are very comfortable. 
Although they are very light weight, they are also very durable having gone through several tumbles.
I definitely recommend these shorts!!
review.name: My go to shorts

review.reviewBody: My measured waist is 33-34". I normally wear size 30-32 shorts. I got the Medium since these shorts have the "Tech webbing adjustment" so I figure I can tighten them to fit. It worked great but I was surprised as to how much I had to pull the adjustments. Almost used all of it. I'm curious if the Small would have been a perfect fit. Overall I would say that these shorts are true to fit. The inseam is longer than I would like but I didn't have any issues pedaling, which was a concern after trying them on for the first time. I've done a few DH trails and these shorts are comfortable. I would recommend.
review.name: Great DH Shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts fit great!    They stretch but are not too tight.   There's enough room for my iPhone and the waist sinch tighteners work great too.
review.name: Great MTB shorts

review.reviewBody: I've heard really good things about Merino gear so I thought I'd give this a try. I've only had it on one  trail ride but it was a great jersey. it was a hot day and I didn't feel any discomfort it works. I sweat a lot so it does wick and breathe. I think really the only two things I don't like about this jersey are the really low cut neck and the fact that I have to wash it with delicates. I already expected with Merino wool not to be able to dry it in the dryer so not a big deal. but hand washing with woolite or something seems like more hassle than it's worth.
review.name: Good jersey

name: Switch Merino Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody:
It is very comfortable but feel safe.
Used in spring snow and Backcountry skiing.
Very light and open. Fresh air around your head. You have to use solar protection on your ears!!
review.name: Game changer

review.reviewBody: I have been backcountry touring for at least 15 years and used to never go with a helmet in the BC, but decided I am old enough to know better now.  All it takes is a simple binding failure and/or a good tumble into some unknown sharks or a tree to end up in a chair for life.  I like the low profile for storage onto my airbag pack for on the way up and I can sacrifice a pound to not get scalped by a tree.  I have never inflated my airbag pack either, but if you can afford safety why not?  I think this might be good for airflow at the resort on those hot spring days also.  I have cracked helmets skiing off piste at the resort so now maybe I will take some steeper lines in the BC.
review.name: The fit works well for my skull

review.reviewBody: I purchased this helmet for ski mountaineering and backcountry skiing based on the positive review in Backcountry Magazine. I decided to return it unused for a few reasons. 1. Although it provides MIPS protection it weighs about the same as better insulated helmets. 2. I found it difficult to manage goggles as the back half of the helmet doesn't come down very far. I usually don't tour with the helmet on, but put it on when descending or if there are rock fall concerns - so ultimately having extra insulation was something I realized I wanted
review.name: Well reviewed, not for me

review.reviewBody: I am sorry the previous reader had a negative experience with this helmet.  Please know  its truly is a revolutionary helmet.  Also, please know I don?t have a horse in this race. But I am an industry expert, a ski area manager, ski patrol, and an alpine ski coach.  What the previous reviewer was referring to in their opening comment, the four attachment points, that?s the heart of the MIPS system.  The plastic layer connected by four points, provides slide, rather than grip, if our fragile melons take a hit.  By reducing grip and intruding slide, the helmet essentially prevents whip-lash type forces from injury to the brain.  (i.e MIPS disperses the rotational force from reaching our brains directly).  Anyway, I happen to love this helmet.  It?s light and it works great for its intended purpose.  That said, everyone?s head is different, so what might fit some might not work for the next...Happy hunting.
review.name: Amazing Helmet

name: Ascender Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody:
Just finished a ride on a 43* evening and my legs were cold while everything else was sweating. I could feel the cold temp on my knees and thighs the whole ride. There was no wind except from my own speed and I could feel the air penetrating the length of my tights. There are no stirrups so the legs also bunch at the ankle and in general, I was very very disappointed.

The correct description should read these ARE meant for milder winter rides between 50-60*f
More like good for early fall but definitely not winter bib tights. The straps also chaffed my nips and that is unacceptable on any day of the year.
review.name: Not windproof, not for very cold days!

review.reviewBody:
Before I put these on, I blew air through the fabric, and it was just like a pair of summer bib shorts..  The fabric is very thin and has no wind blocking properties as all.  I didn't ride in them but returned them right away.    

The description on this web page indicating these tight are good for frigid weather differs from reviews that seem to indicate a temperature range of mid 40s-60 F.  That seems about right given the weight and feel.  I would not say that these tights would be capable of staring down winter's frostiness like a log cabin's cozy warm fire° as stated in the description.   

They are nice pants, and feel fine.  Gore makes nice stuff, but these pants certainly aren't for the cold.
review.name: Not for Cold Weather - Description Off

name: C5 Thermo Bib Tights+ - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great fit. The front zipper is awesome and I can never see myself going back to non-zip waders. I was launching my raft down some rock and slipped about 5 feet. I thought for sure there would be cuts or deep abrasions on my bottom and legs. No rips and no leaks. As always, Simms delivers.
review.name: Great fit. Easy access. Durable.

review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable, fits proportionately. The  added padding on top of neoprene boots provides comfort and full fit  when using fins. Multiple pockets with zip seal is incredibly smooth and tight.
I preferred older padded shoulder straps with buckle release.
Although more durable, new straps are stiff and edges dig in when wearing t-shirt .
review.name: Overall I love the G4Z

review.reviewBody: Have used them several times since purchase.  No leaks and super comfortable. The zipper makes it so much easier to get in and out and for when nature calls.

All I can say is thank you Simms! 

This is the wader I've been waiting for. It's hard to pick just one new features that I'm most impressed by, but the overall weight was the first thing I noticed. They are noticeably lighter than their predecessors. 

The new shoulder straps are also much more comfortable and more breathable than I expected. 

I've been fortunate to beat them up pretty hard since the fall and have yet to have any leaking issues. Whether that's the GORE-TEX, seams or zipper!
review.name: The World's Best!

review.reviewBody:
The new Simms G4Z waders are my favorite wader to date. 
The comfortable fit allows me to move without constraint in and out of my drift boat. The relaxed fit is enhanced with the addition of the front zipper. The front zipper allows one to get in and out of the waders with ease. 
The  zippered front,  fleeced lined pockets, great for keeping the hands warm,  and are just the right size to hold a few extra items. These waders are comfortable, well fitted and ideal for fishing long days.
review.name: Gz4

review.reviewBody: This is the best wader I've ever used.  They have done a full PNW winter steelhead season, a trip to Sweden with lots of hiking and aggressive wading, full summer trout season in freestone pocket water, 2 trips to BC, full PNW fall steelhead season, and back to winter steelhead season again with zero issues.  They have held up 100% through bush bashing, miles of hiking, and aggressive wading, all while being the most comfortable waders I've owned.   I especially love the new adjustable suspender system.  You can adjust how they ride on your shoulders with the amount of bulk you have underneath as the seasons change...so they aren't either too loose, or dig down into your shoulders with heavier layers or if you have all the pockets stuffed, which I usually do.  If you prefer using the best possible gear available when fishing,  just get these.
review.name: Simply the best

review.reviewBody: Working in Alaska for nine seasons and on the water for over 250 days a year I need a wader that is bombproof. The increased durability allows me to bush whack through the willows, climb in and out of boats constantly, and wade the most challenging runs in my area. The breathability is crucial as you don’t want to be sweating your butt off only to freeze later on in the day when you settle in to your fishing. To be honest, I was apprehensive of testing these out in Alaska in October because spoiler alert, it’s cold as heck. But I was pleasantly surprised. Every couple years Simms will upgrade their waders, and once again the improvements are extremely noticeable. This is why I believe there isn’t a company out there that can match the quality and longevity of the G4.
review.name: Bombproof

review.reviewBody: I have been more than pleased with the new G4Z Wader. They are an exceptional wader that provides outstanding protection from the elements without sacrificing comfort or style. For the past year these waders have performed flawlessly during my guide trips on the Truckee River. They look sharp, are easy to move around in, and they keep me dry. The main front zipper is absolutely waterproof while being easy to engage and disengage. I love the swarm of practical pockets strategically placed throughout the wader. These pockets allow me to streamline my attire (leave the hip pack) and approach the water with less cumbersome gear.
review.name: current king

review.reviewBody: My G4Z waders didn’t last nearly as long as my previous G3 waders.  I’m not impressed by the quality … especially considering the huge price!
review.name: G4Z not worth the money

name: G4Z Stockingfoot Wader - Men's

hasVariant.name: Honey Bee Bike Trailer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Honey Bee Bike Trailer online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have a 29er and was trying to find a trailer that would work with my bike, be comfortable for my toddler, and was worth the money. So far, I have found that in the Honey Bee: Easy to assemble, great storage, and converts to stroller. Worth my investment.
review.name: 29er: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody: I bought the Burley Honey Bee from Backcountry because they had the best price around, free shipping at the time, and gave me a law enforcement discount. So far I’ve used the honey bee multiple times, and my son loves it. Seems to bd very high quality!
review.name: Burley Honey Bee

review.reviewBody:
So far we love this product and our kids love it as well. The straps fit our kiddos 1 year old all the way to our 5 year old when he gets tired on his own bike. The ease-ability of switching from Stroller to Bike is amazing, you just pull the tire down. The large ties as well make it so simple to put air in the tires (our last one was awful). I think this was made to go the distance. 

Only complaint, the front wheel when you turn it into a stroller is not good for running. As an avid runner (7:30pace per mile for easy runs) this tire is awful. It's a plastic tire so there's no fluid motion and it's hard to turn. Luckily, we bought this for biking purposes and it has 100% exceed our expectations on that front!
review.name: Perfect Accessory for Biking

review.reviewBody: Our Burley has been a great addition to our days! We love taking it out for strolls with our two kids. Tons of storage for all the snacks, balls, equipment, blankets we need!
review.name: So fun!

review.reviewBody: I have two granddaughters who have just started having children (my great grandchildren). I bought the first Honey Bee a little over a year ago and now I purchased another for my other granddaughter who is expecting in March. I purchased my first Burley for these grandchildren over 25 years ago and I wouldn't want anything but a Burley for my great grandchildren. Nothing but the best for my kids.
review.name: Two Great Grandchildren, Two Burleys

review.reviewBody: We own a Burley Roo that is about 25 years old and decided to upgrade for our grandchild. So much has changed, except for the quality, which we thought could not be improved upon. Burley has and in all the correct places and now attaches to our electric bike with disc brakes....
review.name: Old and New Reliable

review.reviewBody:
Have been using this product for jogs and bike rides for about 30 days now, probably about 60 miles on it and so far very satisfied. Rides smooth. Purchased this in anticipation of having two kids in it, but so far have only had one.

One minor flaw, when in bike mode, the front wheel tends to shake loose and just drag on the pavement. Easily fixed with a velcro loop or a flexible gear tie. Kind of surprised this is not provided with the product, as I don't see how anyone could bike with this and not secure the wheel.

I am definitely going to get my moneys worth, and I would recommend this to anyone.
review.name: Very Satisfied

review.reviewBody: Fantastic build quality with ease of use. Our daughter absolutely loves riding in it and it holds plenty of cargo for park/picnic activities!
review.name: Fantastic build quality with ease

review.reviewBody:
Dear Sir/Madam, this is not really a review, but it is the only way (that I saw) on your website to give you feedback. I am an atypical user. I have no kids; I use my HoneyBee to hold *me* up. I have a form of muscular dystrophy called DM2 that, muscle-wise, tends to atrophy lower back and quad muscles. I *can* walk — I *should* walk — but my back tends to collapse forward unless it is supported. The HoneyBee with its widely adjustable handle works great so I can literally walk miles.
For ballast I carry camera gear including a tripod. The HoneyBee works great for this.
My problem? I got a flat tire the other day. The problem was the outer heavy-duty rubber had cracked all the way around the tire, thus, allowing the inner tube to slide. I’m not after a replacement; I just want to bring it to your attention. My HoneyBee rarely leaves a concrete sidewalk so this should not be from wear-and-tear.
It strikes me that the “disability” market may be something for you to explore. I’d be happy to answer questions for you.
Tom C.
review.name: Life-Support System

review.reviewBody:
I love this trailer! I have to say, I don't usually write reviews but I have gotten really great customer service and so far, I feel really good about this trailer that I thought I would leave a review.
First of all, it is extremely easy to install. I believe it was like 7:45am when I decided I wanted to use the trailer but it was still in the box and I needed to leave with my kids at 8:00am to drop them off at school. It literally took 15 minutes to install this trailer. 
Second, the trailer is extremely light. It is lighter than my strollers. This makes it so easy to maneuver. 
My kids love this trailer and it is super compact.
Some minor issues. First the yellow rubber on the side of the tire has already fallen off. I can put it back on but it seems like it can fall off again.
Also, if I use this trailer as a stroller, I can't put too much heavy weight in the back as the trailer tips and is back heavy.
Overall, excellent purchase and highly recommend it.
review.name: Amazing Trailer Overall

name: Honey Bee Bike Trailer

review.reviewBody:
It's see thru! I can see my hundo dollar bill from both sides of the wallet :/ 
I love the feel, love the look, and absolutely love that it's eco-friendly! I just wish there had been some mention of it being kind of see-thru.
review.name: Really love it but...

review.reviewBody: My old leather wallet was starting to go so I found this guy and decided to give it a try. I’ve had it several weeks now and I am really happy with it so far. It is ultra light and even with about a dozen cards it feels much thinner than my old leather one. It seems like it will hold up well and should resist stretching that is common in more natural materials. Hope to get as many years out of it as my last wallet.

review.reviewBody: My size up from a small to a medium and it fits pretty snug on me as someone who is 5'6 and 150 lbs with decent arms and a gym chest. It definitely keeps a chill out but it doesn't breathe as well as I would hope. After a 30 mi ride with only a thousand feet of climbing and on a 55° F day, the inside was pretty wet from condensation and sweat and my jersey was pretty wet from sweat as well. Wish it had a double zipper so you can zip it up from the bottom when climbing, that would make this a much better and breathable jacket.
review.name: Size up and it fits well but...

review.reviewBody: 3 seasons of use, stuffed in back pocket, on self.. ect. Great.
review.name: Awesome Jacket

review.reviewBody: Great price on sale at $59. Good fit, I went a size larger as suggested. Excellent quality. Very satisfied
review.name: A Great Buy

review.reviewBody: I bought this to wear in the morning when the temp is rising from 50-ish to jersey-only weather. Put on base layer (also to be removed later), jersey and this, and great from start to finish.  Works nicely with only the jersey when it's just a tad cool for one layer. Fits snuggly and looks good too. (as always with this brand, buy one size larger.)
review.name: Perfect to take the edge off cool breeze

review.reviewBody: Believe the reviews that say this item runs small!  I ordered a medium and had to exchange for a large.  The large was still a slim fit which is a good thing because it does not flap in the wind like many other jackets.  It is extremely lightweight but still provides a measure of warmth.  It is great for the days that are cool in the early morning and then stows easily in a jersey pocket when the temp rises.  High quality jacket at a great price.
review.name: Great lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: Have a size small Pactimo rain jacket that fits and purchased a medium as a replacement. It feels great but is way too tight on the body and arms. Sizing should be changed to better match Castelli's jerseys.
review.name: Great jacket... but way too small

review.reviewBody: I needed a packable cool weather jacket that wasn't like a trash bag. Castelli did a great job with this one. The jacket has a mesh fabric under the arms and into the armpits that allows a little air exchange giving this jacket nice breathability. This makes it great for me for temps into the high 30's. Any temps lower and I'd go for something heavier. It packs up into half a jersey pocket space no problem. Finally, this is a Castelli product so the fit is tight. I'm 6' and 150 lbs. A medium fit perfectly when I usually get small. Buyers probably should size up.
review.name: Breathable jacket

review.reviewBody: Runs small so get the next size up. I usually get a small but went with a medium based on reviews. Medium is still kind of tight but not too bad. Overall SUPER light and easy to pack down in a pocket.
review.name: Great lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately this runs very small, I am 5'11" and weight 174lbs and I ordered a large and I could hardly fit into it.  I can't speak on the performance since I will be returning it.
review.name: Squadra Stretch Jacket

review.reviewBody: Does what it's designed for. Easily stowed in jersey pocket. Keeps chill wind or light drizzle out. Snug fit, so follow the size chart. 5'8" 147lbs: size L works for me.
review.name: ultra-light wind/drizzle protection

name: Squadra Stretch Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Also, be aware that the pot is quite large, so it may be more than what a single person needs unless you're preparing multiple meals. Overall, this set is a great investment for any outdoor enthusiast looking for a reliable and versatile camp kitchen solution. I am a van camper and often travel for months at a time.
review.name: Great product

review.itemreviewed: Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently got to try this ' Sea To Summit' "Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit" for FREE in exchange for my honest opinion, thanks to INFLUENSTER! This is one of the best kitchen sets I've used! I love that it's so versatile, can be used for a lot of different things, like making pasta, or simmering! The strainer & the pot are both collapsible! Which adds to why I love this kitchen essentials set! It's great for taking on camping trips, as it's safe for gas, and electric stove tops. I also love the cutting boards because they're lightweight and easy to use & even easier to CLEAN! This set is everything you need to enjoy the taste of home cooking when on the go & enjoying nature!
review.name: Sea to Summit' Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit is Awesome because it's so lightweight and Versatile!

review.itemreviewed: Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pot is awesome and I can’t wait to try it. It’s like nothing I’ve seen before. It’s perfect to use and easy to store in travel trailer or any camping sight where you have limited space
review.name: Awesome

review.itemreviewed: Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Can you say CAMPING ALL SUMMER LONG?! It’s so frustrating to carry a regular pot when you just want to relax by a fire with your friends. This is the best to happen to me yet. Collapsible? With a secure lid? A cutting board? A colander? Hello !! Super excited to try this out.
review.name: Summer 2024 Ready

review.itemreviewed: Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Introducing the Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - the perfect set for all your camping culinary needs! It comes complete with a collapsible stainless steel/silicone rubber pot, a silicone rubber colander, and two polypropylene cutting boards. It has dual Click-Safe handles on the pot help you to securely hold, carry or pour from it safely without worrying about burning yourself. This set is perfect for anyone who loves camping in the great outdoors! The silicone in this set is completely safe for cooking and is BPA PFOA PTFE free. My family loves to go camping and spend as much time outside as possible so this set is perfect for us.
review.name: Perfect for family camping

review.itemreviewed: Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the most wonderful invention for backpacking! This Cook Set Multi - is everything I need for a great vacation. Now is just the time to go camping. I have a set for one person, everything is high-quality and compact. does not take up much space and is very light. A big plus is that the pot's handle folds up. One more important thing that the bowl / cup be held comfortably when contents are hot because the Cool Grip surface allows you to hold the tableware securely while providing insulation from hot contents.. I can't recommend this enough! Buy one now. You won't regret it.
review.name: Great cook set for nice camping

review.itemreviewed: Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Thank you, SEA TO SUMMIT and Influenster for sending me the Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit Multi! I love how compact the kit is including a pot, two cutting boards, and a strainer. The quality feels very durable and will be so easy to stow away!
review.name: Nice and Durable

name: Detour Essentials Camp Kitchen Kit - 2 Person

description: Buy the Maxxis Aspen Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aspen Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Maxxis Aspen Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My thoughts on the Aspen are pretty simple. No other tire that is this fast or this grippy will last quite as long. If you need to run a reliable tire on your go-fast bike, you won't go wrong with the Aspen. Schwalbe and Specialized make some tires that feel great and roll quick, but they don't last nearly as long as the Aspen's do.
review.name: All-around XC goodness

review.reviewBody: I got these on my 2019 Santa Cruz Blur and had some slide outs the first few times I rode them, probably a combination of the new bike and new tires. But ever since then, these have been awesome on hardpack like we generally have in Ohio. I even used them out in Arizona on Slim Shady/Llama when my other bike was locked in a storage unit and they held up fine.  I'm now at 1100 miles on these tires with 0 flats (and they honestly don't feel like they've lost much grip at all), and I'm due to get some new tires...just not sure I want to try any others now that I've found the limits of these. On the other hand, if you ever ride in the wet, these are terrible...but that's not what they're made for. Overall very happy with the speed and durability. For reference I have no idea what pressures I run them at (probably low 20s)...it's pretty much all by feel, because if you have too much air, you'll know it.  Normally I just make sure I can't touch the rim of the back wheel when pushing on my hand with all of my body weight, and then a bit less in the front since there's generally less weight up there. They've taken some hard hits, rock abrasions, and rim strikes with no problems.
review.name: First XC tire...hesitant to try others..

name: Aspen Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire

review.reviewBody: I live in an area where everyone complains about killing bottom brackets and hub bearings constantly, but I put a bit of this grease in all my bearings twice a year and everything just works, no complaints. I'm not sure if it's better or worse than other grease on the market but it's a great price for the amount you get and is in a convenient tube, and the color is a cool blue. Anyway, it keeps my bike happy, been using it for years.
review.name: Keeps everything moving

review.reviewBody: Finally had a chance to use the Park Tool HPG-1 grease and was very impressed with it. I?ve used other grease before but I can tell this grease was different from the others. This is a great addition if you are doing some bike maintanance yourself.

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE Windstopper Thermo Trail Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this but the cut was just a bit slim for my intended use -- I don't race, just trail ride and ride for exercise so I don't need/want a skin-tight jacket. review.name: Cut too slim for a "trail jacket"

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE Windstopper Thermo Trail Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: The jacket is well made. Though light weight, the jacket does it's job of keeping the wind out and keeping the heat in. The style is attractive enough to wear in casual settings. The fit is snug but not tight.
review.name: Great Fit and Comfort

description: Buy the Burley Baby Snuggler online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Baby Snuggler
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Baby Snuggler online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Definitely worth the money for the quality product you are getting. I have bought cheaper brands but Burley is worth the money. And I like the accessories that accommodate our adventurous lifestyle.
review.name: Bang for your Buck

review.reviewBody: Love that this helped support our baby so we could get out a bit before 6 months. It adds some cushion but there is still a forward tilt so this doesn’t completely feel safe. I checked on our daughter a lot to make sure she was okay while sleeping during walks. Our six month old is almost 16 lbs and will likely continue to use this for a while until she fills out more!
review.name: Helpful for little ones!

review.reviewBody: Just as advertised, fits super well in our burley honey bee. I was happily surprised to see the mating velcro on the underside of the snuggler, keeps it perfectly in place with the velcro in our honey bee! I recommend it. Baby must hold his head though, only used for walking.
review.name: Just as advertised, fits super

review.reviewBody: Provides great additional support for our little one. Easy to install.
review.name: Provides great additional support for

review.reviewBody: We use our Burley as a double stroller and a bike tow for our two little guys. They absolutely love riding in it, especially since they can see out the sides. It holds all of the "stuff" you always have as a parent - diaper bag, toys for the park, blankets, etc. We love using our Burley on the weekends - it gives us so much mobility to go around our neighborhood in active way.
review.name: We love Burley!

review.reviewBody: It’s not as sturdy as I’d like to actually hold my 6 month up. And for summer it’s a little bothersome as it gets my kiddo hot, but overall it does its job. Just make sure to have a small stroller fan if you use this in summer. I wish burley make an actual baby hammock like Thule but this does a good job for the purpose and price point.
review.name: Good but could be better

review.reviewBody: Perfect for our 6 month old to be able to ride comfortably and securely on bike rides with us! Would not be super great for smaller babies who cannot hold head up.
review.name: Perfect fit! Great purchase.

review.reviewBody: The smuggler is warm and secure for my baby since she was 5 months old and we love it. Expensive but has allowed us to use the ski setup sooner and not wait until she was big enough for the regular harness. She’s very comfy and cozy in it!
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: Very nice but waiting to use as baby is only 2 month old.
review.name: Very nice but waiting to

review.reviewBody: Definitely adds the extra support our baby needs to go on adventures at 5 months. She can almost sit up on her own but not fully.
review.name: Adds the extra stability and support our 5 month old needs

name: Baby Snuggler

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, stretchy, not tight, quick dry. A bit clingy when wet. Doesn’t chafe or itch. Quiet logo.
review.name: Nice shirt

review.reviewBody: The Freewheel Short Sleeve Jersey is more like a daily driver shirt over a traditional jersey. You can wear it daily for day to day tasks then hit the trail after work. The material is similar to other Outdoor Research shirts in the 2024 clothing catalog. I took the shirt for weekly rides on local trail heads in MD in spring and on the Santos Trails in FL on a work trip. The stretch is nice when you catch a sticker bush and length is nice if you have a long torso. The only con in my opinion is that a bring color would be nice for hunting seasons. I currently have the blue shirt and it looks good.
review.name: Solid shirt for daily riding!!!

review.reviewBody: Finally got the chance to ride in this. Breathable and is a nice fabric. I don't see a huge difference between riding in this versus any tech fabric shirt though. It also feels big. I think a snugger fit would help as I worry about snagging it on branches.
review.name: Happy with it but not groundbreaking

review.reviewBody:
I've already put this thing through its paces over a few MTB rides and love it. Material is thin but substantial, has the right amount of stretch, and is ready to take on many more miles. I typically wear a size large shirt and stuck with that here, and the proportions are spot-on. It's not a slim-fit per se, but not baggy at all. This should 100% be at the top of your list if you're looking for a lightweight jersey that doesn't fall under the typical loose-fit MTB styling. Typical OR quality, fun to wear as a casual piece, and good color choices. Send it, and reach out to a Gearhead to get some OR bike gear headed your way!

#BackcountryGearheads #CompetitiveCyclistGearheads
review.name: Stretchy, Breathable, Dialed

review.reviewBody: It's light and cozy with a casual fit. Feels like a nice piece of techy clothing and isn't restrictive at all.
review.name: Great Tech Tee

review.reviewBody: Not a ton to say here, it's tech-tee for hitting the trails. The fit is great, not too baggy, not too fitted in all the right places. The fabric feels a bit heavier than my normal collection of jerseys and I was wondering if it would ride hotter. It's super soft and comfortable when first putting it on! Last night's ride was a muggy 84 degrees, and although it was sticky out, I could feel the fabric wicking and felt it cooling! I was impressed! We'll see how it handles triple digit Texas heat this summer, but I expect it do well.
review.name: A simple, great performing jersey

name: Freewheel Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I just used this for a week trip i packed a ton of clothes and still had plenty of room i bought the bright green one love it especially when digging for clothes everything is visible with the hi viz green. Me an over an overpacker I took another large duffle bag suitcase and my cotopaxi allpa 42l the backpack straps on patagonia are very comfortable on your back when the bag is fully packed! My gf she couldn’t believe me how much space it has as well i got her into buying one. Were planning on buying the 55 and 100 we both our overpackers. I’m very happy i bought this already looking forward to pack it up for camping and air travel to the beach
review.name: LOVE IT HUGE FOR OVERPACKERS LIKE ME

review.reviewBody:
Bought Ghost Whisper pants and Stretchdown pants in size Medium. 
Im a Regular 5'5 130 built a solid size 6.
 
The Ghost Whisper ran bigger then the StretchDown.
 I would say an all around 1/2 inch on both sides and length 

Stretchdown was still big for my size 6 frame but was worried the small would be too tight. 
 Little bigger in the backside. 
Verdict-I chose the StretchDown Pants that are a little big on me.
review.name: Comparing Down Pants

review.reviewBody: Great puffy pants and very warm. I own the Compressor pants which I love but they’re a bit too big to wear skiing. I wear these Ghost Whisperer pants as my base layer when skiing in cold temps. The fit is a bit weird - kind of wide in hips and thighs and tight in calves but I appreciate the zips on the legs. I also wear them out to walk the dog and they’re very comfortable.
review.name: Warm and stylish

review.reviewBody: These pants are very generous in the waist.  Although they have a drawstring, I am a size 27 waist and they feel and look huge on me. They are not something o feel comfortable wearing as they are long and large in the waist. They seem to fit well in the length (I’m 5’6) and approximate to wear under ski shells, etc. I also discovered They feel similar to wearing a sleeping bag, which is overall a strange feeling!
review.name: Roomy in the waist

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, warm and cozy! Comfortable, nonrestrictive fit!  Will definitely be adding these to my thru hiking pack!
review.name: Perfect pants for colder weather hiking

review.reviewBody:
I got these for work since I have an outside job all winter. I wasn’t sure if I really needed them since I figured core heat was more important but they are so warm they had me sweating! I work in 0° - 35° and often in the snow/wind. These are a lifesaver!!!

Also I am 5’ 10 with a 32” inseam and usually get size small. I went with the size small, long version. They are a tiny bit baggier than I thought they’d be but they have good mobility.
review.name: Sooo warm

name: Ghost Whisperer Pant - Women's

hasVariant.name: ComfyCush Old Skool Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vans ComfyCush Old Skool Shoe online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these directly after buying some old skool skate shoes. The new old skool shoes are great, not narrow, and the soles are removable. I figured the shape of these would be similar at least, but they are in fact far more narrow. The soles on these are not review removable. The toe box is plush, but the heels are stiff. The toe box itself, is the most uncomfortable part of the shoe because of how narrow it is. Buy the old skool skate shoe itself.
review.name: Another review about them being narrow

review.reviewBody: The Vans products thenselves are awesome and I have never had beef with this particular style. The Vans I ordered from Backcountry were less than good conditions as the soles were literally falling off the shoes. I superglued them on and received a partial refund, but this lack of quality assurance puts me off of ordering from backcountry for anything.
review.name: Soles

review.reviewBody:
Love the look. I have bought Old Skool Vans in the past at the same size and have had no issues. With these, I could not get my feet into the shoe, no matter how much I adjusted the laces. 
A truly terrific shoe, just not fit for me.
review.name: Too narrow

review.reviewBody: This shoe have a completely different shape from the classic Vans.  It?s not just the new sole.  The fit is a little longer and much more narrow than the same size in the classic Vans.  If you?re looking for a wide shoe look elsewhere.
review.name: Narrow

name: ComfyCush Old Skool Shoe

review.reviewBody: The grip is werth the price too invest in cuz they dont wear away hardly.....the clip in screw area tho kinda makes it slippery when u step on small rock on pavement...there comfirtable tho i give the shoes a 9 out of 10 for quality..,grip is a 9 out of 10 also....and sale price is a 9 out of 10 also....
review.name: The grip on these shoes are werth buying

review.reviewBody: Noticed that a review for the RIME 1.0 mountain bike shoe was a ?wide? fit.  I don?t think that is true.  I am currently wearing wide Sidi?s and I was looking for a more walking friendly shoe for hike a bike sections.  The shoes look well built with an excellent grippy sole.  Length was good, just to narrow for me.
review.name: Sizing

review.reviewBody: I really love these shoes. I use them for my flat pedals on my gravel bike. They run wide so for me having a wide foot they really work out for me. They are stiff which I like for pedaling power. Because they are stiff they are not great for walking but I find them  good for walking. I didn't by them to walk in I bought them for pedaling. I was getting foot pain in my left foot with my old shoes I was using which were another brand but with these no foot pain at all. Oh, and they don't slip at all. They really grip the pedals and I am confident when pedaling hard, even out of the saddle I feel like I am locked to the pedals. So glad I got these.
review.name: Love these Rime 1.0 shoes

review.reviewBody: Fits true to length, but the width and volume is a bit big. Velcro strap is a nice feature that really secures your foot. Really like how the cleats are recessed so you can walk normal.
review.name: Solid Shoe

review.reviewBody: I read reviews that said that the main difference is the soles. I think the tongue in the 1.0 is different from the 2.0 too. The rime 2.0 shoes are more comfortable than the 1.0 shoes.
review.name: the rime 2.0 are more comfortable

review.reviewBody: The fit is perfect, minimal flex with solid traction. At under 50 hours and just a little over a month, the sole is falling apart already. There's a newer version with Vibram sole that may perform better than these did. I hope these are flawed and covered under warranty.
review.name: Are you a casual rider?

name: RIME 1.0 Mountain Bike Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great boots! Haven’t worn them hiking just yet but looking forward to trying them out. I did have to exchange for a bigger size, they run small.
review.name: Great!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are cute and perfect for hiking. The soles have lugs for traction and the suede upper seems durable. They are very comfortable but I found them to be a half a size too short. I am always an 8.5 and in these, my toes were a bit smushed. Definitely size up, especially if you want to wear thick socks.
review.name: Cute and functional.

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the shoes so comfy and I didn’t have a wear in time
review.name: Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like this model is it is a good strong comfortable fit w solid ankle support      Tho not 100% waterproof.
review.name: Good hiking boots!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are so comfortable and they look cute too!  They're not too bulky but will be a staple when I'm out this winter.
review.name: Love these boots!!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Boot was a great choice for my wife. They’re stylish, durable, perfect for her outdoor adventures!
review.name: rfect Blend of Style, Comfort, and Durability!"

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered up and the boots were still tight. My toes was right up on the heels. Had to return them. A 3 only because I didn’t expect such a disconnect with the shoe size. 
But I have ordered other boots and accessories without any problems. I love this store.

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these boots. It’s my second pair from Columbia. I have no doubt that any boot purchases that I make In the future will come from Columbia.
review.name: Great boots for a great price

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these as a last minute purchase before a hiking trip because I had finally worn out my old boots, and hiked 30+ miles in them fairly comfortably right out of the box with no break in period. I was impressed by the waterproofing, but I was disappointed by the lack of traction and could have used a more comfortable sole when hiking for long periods. These boots were just fine on dirt trails but when conditions on inclines were wet, snowy, or icy I found myself wishing I had something that didn't feel so precarious - especially when seeing how well my friends' boots performed in the same conditions, as they were able to easily access places that I needed crampons for.
Went up a half size to accommodate for hiking socks
review.name: Good, but know your trail conditions

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These hiking boots are cute and comfortable. They fit me really well right out of the box. I wear a size 7 in shoes and 7 1/2 in boots to leave room for a thicker socks. I got the 7 1/2.
review.name: Comfy right out of the box

name: Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love these leggings!  I am a size 4 or 6 and I ordered the M/L and glad I did. They fit perfect! Hugs in all the right places, breathable, and comfortable. Very flattering! review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet last month and the manufacturer date is 5/2021. I have always replaced my helmets between 4 and 5 years. So my new helmet isn't so new and should be replaced in less than 2 years 🙃
review.name: Buyers beware

review.reviewBody:
The helmet. Excellent. Light. Great graphics. Fitment is Spot On!!! For me it is perfect. I’m a 56. Amd that’s exactly what the spec’s for a M are. This helmet comes with two liners. Original is with thin and an additional set of thick. I was a little nervous about fitment because this helmet doesn’t have the hookie barrel adj most all other helmets have. This helmet is MIPS. I’ve tried Troy Lee, POC, Giro….this is the best helmet I could find. It fits the best of any other helmet I’ve ever owned and it’s light, man is it light!!!!
Shout out to Backcountry customer service. They are true Rock Stars!!!!
review.name: Customer service is above and beyond!!!!

review.reviewBody:
This is a very stylish and good looking helmet. Got compliments everytime in the trails. It is not the most ventilated helmet, but still can use it in our hot humid trails. Holds the sweat pretty well in the forehead cushion. Adjustment-wise however, there is none. The visor is fixed and is not adjustable. The sizing is fixed, and there is no knob to adjust anything... so get your sizing right!  Beware that the sizing in this page does NOT include the Dropframe helmet. I went with what the Proframe sizing was, asuming it was the most similar to the Dropframe... but nah. 

Inside my MEDIUM helmet the sizing is spec'd from 54cm-56cm. 
Hope this helps! 
Cheers.
review.name: No adjustments, so get it right!

review.reviewBody: I have always been a small/medium helmet guy. My head circumference is 57....Which put me (according to the sizing chart) right in the middle of the 56-58 Medium size. After reading a few reviews here...I decided to size UP...To a LARGE. Really glad I did. The large fits my "medium" head perfectly. Because this helmet was in low inventory just about everywhere I looked...I even had a medium-sized helmet saved in my cart, just in case the large was too large. It wasn't. Perfect fit. Incredible helmet. Fit and finish is amazing. Protection with the MIPS and fuller-coverage over ears and jaw is state-of-the-art...But the helmet is light enough to where I don't feel restricted...Or stuffy like some full face helmets. Really thoughtful design. One of the more expensive helmets I've ever purchased. Well worth the money. Fox Stuff always impresses.
review.name: Awesome Helmet. Sizing Kinda Wacked.

review.reviewBody: Medium was too small.   Ordera large.   Also too small.   Have a medium in other helmets and have had no problem with fit.   As usual, Backcountry offers excellent and fast return service.
review.name: Second try?sized up.   Still too small.

review.reviewBody: Like the look.   Sizing was way off?runs very small.  I?ve had medium sized lids from a variety of brands (Smith, Fox, POC, Specialized, Troy Lee).   All great fits.   Could hardly get this one over my noggin.   Thought like they accidentally sent me a child?s medium.   Returned it.   Customer service at Backcountry is excellent.   Easy return.
review.name: Sized like a children?s helmet

review.reviewBody: If you are considering getting a full face and a half shell, but don't want to spend the money on both, then look no further! This helmet is the perfect combo, with great side, and back protection to give you the confidence to push your riding. With full-face helmets, it can sometimes be hard to hear your surroundings, but with the open ear hole, you can hear everything and even have space for a wireless earbud if you like to listen to music. Fits seamlessly with googles as well!
review.name: Best of both worlds!

review.reviewBody: This is by far one of the best if not the best when it comes to protection, and weight. This helmet offers so such, and for the price it’s pretty good. This site is legit I was a little skeptical about the reviews online but this site is 100% legit, but also I’ve got to say that this site has by far one of the best customer service ever.
review.name: Best Helmet ever.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love the extra sense of protection of my Dropframe Pro helmet. Luckily (knock on wood) I haven't had any major impacts, but I have no doubt it would do its job to keep my noggin safe. As seen in other reviews, it does run a little snug, so if you're close to in-between sizes I would recommend sizing up. I am a medium in most other helmets and went with the large. It breathes fairly well, I've had to take it off a few times when climbing in the hot sun. BUT the nice thing is you can hang it on your bars by the ear protection loops. Sunglasses fit fine with the ear pads and I have run goggles with it on some dusty bike park days and they integrate fantastic with no sliding of the strap (I use the Smith Squad MTB). ALSO I get lots of compliments on how cool the helmet is on the trail!
review.name: Looks super cool!

name: Dropframe MIPS Helmet
