review.reviewBody: these are the softest shoes I have ever put on.we will see how long they last, buy wow are they soft, like walking on marshmallows
review.name: super comfy

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: It's been three years that i buy this model or a similar because they are so confortable and suitable to my job needs. Unfortunately this time the result wasn't as expected. Everytime i wear it , i feel pain im my right toes although they are size wide.
review.name: Bad experience

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved the bouncy softness of version 13. This is JUST as bouncy and even more stable so my ankles don’t hurt! I love this shoe!!
review.name: Best version of the 1080 yet

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I typically run in Brooks but I heard good things about the Fresh Foam 1080's. Took a little getting used but now they feel great!  And they're pretty!
review.name: First timer in 1080's

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fast service. Had to return the item. My own fault. No issues.
review.name: Runnres

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great Shoe! Like walking on cloud. I have Planter Fasciitis and it helps with that too.
review.name: Very comfortable. Like walking on cloud.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore this shoe for one day.  It was reviewed as being good for knees and on your feet all day.   Felt like I was walking on a cloud, so I thought it was fine.  After one day in these shoes, I could barely walk the next day and for a few days after as it made my knees sooooo sore !  Must be the rocking motion ??  Went back to my other shoes and I am fine.  Might be comfy at first, but NOT good for the knees for sure !  Going to return this and try another kind or brand.
review.name: NOT a good shoe for knees or on your feet all day

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am a long term buyer of the women 1080's. I go through about 2 of these shoes a year with the job that I do. With that said, this version is the worst. My right shoe specifically squeaks and it's embarrassing (especially when the room is quiet and I get up). I reached out to their support team and they said I can return it no problem. However I threw away the box because that's how confident I am about the 1080 and with it being the Holiday season, I don't have time to go to the store (that's about a hour away). I still believe in the 1080 but this version has a major defect and I would wait to buy the new version in hopes that this doesn't happen again. Hopefully I'm not the only one who had this problem with this version..
review.name: Quality Concern

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I love the feel of the shoes but they are very tight. 
Normally I have to pull the laces tight but in this case my laces almost wouldn’t tie.
review.name: Fits tight and narrow

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm a healthcare worker and easily spend 12+ hours on my feet, and these shoes provide the support and comfort I need to power through my long shifts.
review.name: Extremely comfortable

name: Fresh Foam X 1080 v14 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Sturdy and very supportive! Can't go wrong with the Moabs!
review.name: Love these.

review.reviewBody: These boots needed no breaking in time for me. They were comfortable right away. I'm headed to Nepal in 4 days and these will be my hiking boots there.
review.name: Great Boots!!!!

review.reviewBody: Tried on the new women's Moab 3 Vent Mid. Lots of design changes. Like the new tread. The upper looks like it will be a bit more durable, especially in the toe area, however it is more stiff which may or may not work for some people. I did not mind that. I like the bracken brown color. However, the new insole/foot bed is where they lost me. I have been happily hiking through Moab 2 shoes for over a decade. Nothing matched their comfort. I have tried different Merrell's, but always come back to Moab 2 Vent Mid for their comfort. Unfortunately, the Moab 3 no longer has that light, instant marshmallow feel that I loved about the Moab 2. The foot bed is stiff and hitting pressure points instantly. It feels a bit like corrective orthopedics. Please bring back the old insole or whatever gave it that amazing feel. For other loyal Moab 2 wearers, you may want to try these on before buying your new pair to make sure the design changes still work for you. It is not the same shoe.
review.name: Moab 3 Design Changes

review.reviewBody:
Great shoe.  Walked for hours in Pompeii and Herculaneum with no leg  or back or foot fatigue.
After 6 hours the August heat did me in!
review.name: Excellent shoe.
comment: Thank you for sharing your adventures with us!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. They were comfortable right out of the box, and I quickly took them to the Adirondack High Peaks and did several long rugged hikes.
review.name: Sturdy lightweight Ballers for your feet

review.reviewBody: These shoes run true to size.  It's very rare that I can find any kind of shoe that fits me properly because the front of my foot is wide, but my heels are narrow.  These shoes fit perfectly - lots of room in the toe box, but no risk of my heel slipping out.  There is great ankle support, and the materials used are sturdy.  The treads are also really good.  The only drawback for me is that the orthotics they come with are very firm.  When I tried them on, my feet were hurting significantly after just one loop around my living room (note that I have a bone disorder, so I may be more sensitive than most).  I'll be replacing the inserts with gel sport orthotics.  Other than that, I'm really happy with them.
review.name: Great shoes, but firm

review.reviewBody: Arch is removable, was very uncomfortable, so I replaced it and that worked.
review.name: Very Comfortable Now

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a trip to Iceland. The ankle support was great for the uneven ground and the grip was super helpful for the wetter rocks and terrain.
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: Second pair of Merrell and disappointed in the quality.  No waterproofing or water repellant qualities.  Took to Colorado for 3 weeks and have had wet feet many hikes.  Would not buy again and would upgrade to a more water resistance material.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment: We're sorry to hear this happened to you. We stand behind our products and we'd love to do all we can to help. We have a 1 year warranty on our products for any manufacturing defects. Please visit our ‘Contact Us’ page at the link below and fill out the Warranty Form to start a claim. If you need any assistance with the form give the team a call at 800-288-3124. Thank you. https://tinyurl.com/bdcuxst9

review.reviewBody: Product was very good. I have worn them for a couple of days so far so good.
review.name: Great shoes

name: Moab 3 Mid Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Instantly one of my favorite bits of kit. Small, lightweight, and an absolute workhorse in some of the more thinly protected climbs of the New River Gorge. Offset stoppers and brassies are great until the direction of pull disagrees with the way they wanna be set, this offset finds its stride in those situations - the stem is strong yet very flexible, making for great multi-directional protection that isn’t prone to walking out of place. I’d take a 20’ winger on a well placed one of these any day.
review.name: Great little piece that fits where others won’t.

name: Offset Zero Friend Cam

hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Trail Pant - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have short legs 5. 7" and these fit excellent (size 30)
This pants are stylish and super comfortable
review.name: Finally a good fit.

review.reviewBody: The pants are really nice if you can manage to get them on. As mentioned in other reviews, the ankle is unreasonably tight. I'm 6ft. 185lb Mens US 9.5 shoes size and wear a 31-32 waist. Everything about these pants feel great but getting them on and off is a serious issue. I purchased these thinking that they couldn't possibly be that difficult to get on and off and thought I could do so carefully. Getting them on was a struggle and I ended up ripping the seam of elastic cuff on the right leg when trying to carefully take them off. Fortunately it was an easy fix and I ended up bringing them to a seamstress to have a triangular piece of fabric added between the vertical seam where the elastic and pant material come together. Sucks that they ripped but I like these too much to go through the hassle of returning them.
review.name: Great Pants Terrible Fit

review.reviewBody: Like others have stated, I couldn't even get these on past my feet. I'm only a size 9.5 foot and the elastic on the ankle cuff wouldn't even stretch over them. The materials and construction of the pant seem great, but I really don't know who would possibly be able to wear these.
review.name: Feet don't fit

review.reviewBody: I never wore these, this is purely a sizing review. I'm 5'8" 175lbs, athletic build, and ordered the 32s. I had to fight to pull the end of the legs over my feet and ankles, and was afraid I was going to rip the stitching. After that ordeal the pants were almost skin tight. The only part of these pants that was true to size was the waist, as it was what I would consider a 32.5; enough room to breathe and have a decent meal but snug enough to keep the pants on. If you're not a skinnier dude for your waist size, these will not fit. Bummer, as they get great reviews and material seems nice.
review.name: Purely a Sizing Review

name: Trail Pant - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Scott Grenade EVO Elbow Guards online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are 6th different pair of elbow pads. I grew up hating to wear them in competitions. I'm grown now and I still despise them, however my bones like them. These are very comfortable, true-size (i usually wear a size large), breathable,  and there was little to no break-in time needed for these to fit snug but not too snug. I've fallen on these, of course it wasn't on purpose I'm no stuntman, on rocks. The pads didn't slide or fail in any manner. I'm not saying these are the best elbow pads ever made but they work the best for me and like i said I've tried a few different brands. I'm on the larger size of large but definitely not an XL. Every XL I've tried initially felt great but within weeks they would break-in and fall. Hope tjos review helps.
review.name: Solid all-around pad

name: Grenade EVO Elbow Guards

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was inclined to purchase the gloves as I've been searching for gloves with a thermal blanket kind of lining for additional heat, as that would be game changing technology for gloves. The reviews of these gloves prove that they aren't to the level they need to be yet. 
Columbia please make a down glove with better metallic/heat blanket like lining. It would be the warmest gloves out there! Looking forward to the next iteration of this glove.
review.name: Gloves Looked Promising
comment: Hey there! We are sorry to hear these gloves didn't hit the mark for you. We would love to assist with finding something that works better. Please feel free to reach out to our Customer Care team if you need further assistance!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Gloves are great! Not bulky on the hands yet still warm. Touch screen ability is an added plus.
review.name: Warm without the bulk

review.reviewBody: I thought these would be great gloves for the cold weather, but unfortunately I wouldn't rate these as suitable for less than 0 Celsius. I wore them this afternoon for a walk in -14C and my hands actually hurt, they were so cold. The Omni-Heat feature does nothing because the fabric is so thin, the heat can't be retained and immediately escapes. I would have been just as well off with bare hands. I'm incredibly disappointed because I chose these instead of the larger mittens...and now I feel like I wasted my money. I didn't want spring gloves, I wanted something that would be useful during winter. These are NOT that.
review.name: Epic disappointment
comment: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide your feedback! We will make sure this is passed along to the appropriate teams regarding opportunities for improvement on this product. Thank you for choosing Columbia!

review.reviewBody: These gloves are worthless. I'd give them zero stars if I could. I measured my hands and ordered according to the size chart, but they are the most ill-fitting gloves I've ever owned. The fingers are way too long, but the "webbing" area is way to short. They also do not keep my hands warm in the slightest bit. Wish I had returned them when I had the chance. I will not buy a pair of gloves with out being able to try them on first again. I would like to add that I usually love Columbia's apparel, but these gloves are crap.
review.name: Ill-fitting
comment: We are sorry to hear the quality for this item was not as expected. If we can further assist in getting you connected with a new size or alternate product, please contact our Customer Care support team via phone or chat.

name: Infinity Trail II Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’m very happy with my new Salomon. They keep me dry!
review.name: I love them!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: My first time buying a Goretex sneaker.   Love them as they are breathable and my feet stayed warm and dry on a very wet outing
review.name: Amazingly waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are my first pair of Salomon and I love them. I bought them for a city break and they were so comfortable. Wore them for 6 days walking and didn't have any issues. Size wise I'm a 5 but needed a 5.5 in this shoe. I'm guessing that's due to the Gortex in them. They were expensive but worth every penny.
review.name: Love Them

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve ran 45 kilometres in my Sense Ride 5 gore tex and so far so good! Been through wet muddy, grassy and stony trails and have had dry feet with no blisters! Feel confident underfoot on trails I’ve been on, including roots and stones. Would recommend to trail runners.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really wanted these to work, I have and love the previous versions but these were too snug 😔
review.name: Too narrow

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I recently took these shoes to Japan. I wanted a shoe that did everything - hike, walk, run, waterproof, and easy on and off feature (since many areas and places to visit require you to take off your shoes). These were perfect and comfortable for when I wanted to exercise, hike or just sight-see. I also needed them to be waterproof since the chance of rain was significant.
review.name: Versatile and Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved the Sense Ride 3, but the 5 is clunky and I couldn't get it to fit comfortably around my foot, no matter how many times I adjusted the laces.
review.name: Could be better
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We’re glad to confirm you that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and we’re waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

Disappointed in these. Fit is off and the tongue sticks up like a sore thumb!
Salomon should not have changed design. The 4s were perfect. Well, for me anyway!
review.name: Bring back sense ride 4
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe for running in winter. I really like this shoe because it is waterproof and has some grip on the sole. Would recommend this shoe for only small runs ( like 5km) i tried to run a 12km in them and my knees hurt afterwards. Over all love this shoe. Would use also to go hiking.
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I read the reviews and bought half a size up. They did not feel too small when I just tried them on, but as I started to wear them as it became colder they hurt my big toe and the outer side of my foot. I wore them several times hoping to break them in, but they rather break my feet. I own other Salomon shoes women’s size 7 and run in them regularly and no problem. These are size 7.5. I think Salomon must replace them for me for size 8. Would be very appreciative
review.name: Size up!

review.reviewBody: Will not buy another Patagonia pants again. I had one crash and the pants ripped. I landed on my elbow/forearm (shirt did not ripped) then on my legs (pants ripped). The pocket ripped and my phone went out flying and cracked :( I don’t recommend this pants for fast and rocky terrain. I do recommend this pants for an easy trail riding.
review.name: Thin pants great for summer, not strong

review.reviewBody: Let's be clear these are not gravity pants. If you want that type of riding pant, there are better options. The dirt roamer pant is like a long version of the shorts - but better. I have a couple of the shorts and I'd say the pants have a little extra room and considerably more stretch. These are similar to Rapha's LW trail pants - but better. I have the Rapha pants (size small), which I thought would be hard to beat, until I picked up the patagonia dirt roamer pant. The patagonia pants fit better, IMO, have a better cuff and have well placed ventilation holes which actually work. There are two basic pockets, no extra adjustments, no velcro or cargo pockets - exactly what I was looking for. Regarding durability, I crashed at speed into brush that was recently trimmed (lots of thick, sharp, pointy branches!). Climbing out, I thought the pants would be toast but they were unscathed, not even a blemish - my merino jersey RIP :-(   Also, FWIW, I have the carmel color (kinda orange) and they clean up great, no stains so far. Size wise, I generally wear a 31"Wx30"L in Levi's which will be a little loose. The 30" dirt roamer pants fit perfectly. I just ordered a second pair.
review.name: Better than Rapha - Five Stars

review.reviewBody: The quality of these was not what I expected. The material is thin and there’s not much, if any, reinforcement where needed for actual bike use. I had 20% off and still felt like there are far better options for less money.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: I have lost track of how many weeks I have had them. Bought them to fit my German Shepherd's back feet. Her front feet are bigger, but I am happy to have the second pair as replacement. She has been so active, but is now dragging her hind toes. Trying to keep her active as long as possible. She wears them on our gravel woods road about a mile per day. They hare still holding up and we have not used the second pair yet. I love the elastic velcro strap. Easy to stop and reset if she gets running in her whacky circles. I also love they are not a solid shaped bottom, so the tops of her feet are protected from the dragging, and they do not trip her up. After the initial introduction she now doesn't even notice them and they are part of the routine. These are a lifesaver for my neurologic girl who still wants to run. I appreciate that the end is somewhat rounded like the foot. We tried another brand that was just a straight her on the end. The squared corners were a hindrance for her.
review.name: Couldn't be happier

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my partner during the friends and family event.  I love my Deviator 1/2 zip so I decided to get him two as well.  My partner LOVES IT!!!  He told me that it fits well, feels great against his skin and is so warm.  It has been holding up in cold, windy weather and it’s become his favorite for skiing.  He has been pairing it up with the Trailbreaker ski pants and Super strand jacket.  I got him a large in case he wants to layer under it but so far he hasn’t had the need to do so.  I’m so happy I had the opportunity to purchase this for my partner so he is comfortable in cold weather.
review.name: This 1/2 Zip Is Awesome.

review.reviewBody: This fleece is super warm and compressed. Fits near and tight and still moves with you really well
review.name: Warm and compact

review.reviewBody: I've used this as a hiking/nordic skiing/cold weather running midlayer and it's incredibly versatile. Between the material and the ability to vent via zipping down the chest zipper, it can handle a range of cool to cold conditions.
review.name: Great winter running top

review.reviewBody: It clearly says "Black, Cage Only". This means exactly what it says, cage only (no tools). Cage is great and the only one out there by a decent brand that has storage.
review.name: People need to read

review.reviewBody: I will say that the product seems of very good quality, but unfortunately it did not do what I thought, especially when reading the details. It states "Carry tools and some C02s with this handy cage", but it did not say "WHICH" tools. So, I have a Lenzyn multi tool, but it is not the one that fits in the carry case, you need to make sure you have the "CORRECT" tool. Guess I have to find something else now.
review.name: Not what I thought...

review.reviewBody: I ordered this and did not notice that the only option was "cage only".  It did not include the CO2, the tool, levers, or inflator.  What do I have that could fit in such a small tool box?  Nothing.
review.name: Be careful.  Not as shown!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my dad because he never carries tools so I paid $20 for a cage and $40 for a multi tool. I do understand that it can hold a CO2 and a inflator but with tubeless tires you really shouldn?t use CO2. Having the big box on it makes it a tight fit and my dad rides a XL frame. All in all it?s great but if I were to do it again I would go for a Specialized z cage with the swat multi tool.
review.name: It?s pretty good but not great

review.reviewBody:
Essential commuter trailer!
I have owned a Travoy trailer for over 12 years and use it for my daily commutes. It has plenty of cargo space for my work bag, gym clothes, lunch box, and occasional extra gear. It easily and quickly detaches from the hitch and easily moves through buildings as I go about my work day. I am now on my second Travoy and don't know how I could live without it.
review.name: Essential!

review.reviewBody:
I'm delighted with my Burley Travoy. I use it to take my golf clubs to the course, then disconnect from the bike and use it as a pull trolley, it works perfectly. My large golf bag fits perfectly and the trailor easily coped with London's speed bumps and even a cattle grid at the entrance to the golf course. I also have the upper and lower market bags which are great for my grocery shopping.

My car is now sitting there unused collecting dust!
review.name: Perfect for Golf & Shopping

review.reviewBody: I came back from Korea this morning after a 10days cycling trip with my family from Incheon to Busan over a distance of 650km plus and elevation of easily 3000m plus. As my child is only 10 years old and my wife is not a competent cyclists, I decided to carry the family's load using this Burley Travoy Trailer after weeks of research and going through many reviews on YouTube, forums as well as this testimonial site. I took the leap of faith on this trailer and she never fails me despite minimum "test drive" prior to my trip. It navigated superbly through tight corners, bumpy round terrains, wet weather terrain whether on downhill or up and many more hurdles along the way. I fell once on the trip and once the bike tipped over while parked but this beauty held up ok and continued to do her job hauling about 30kg of load (bike spares, kits, drone, camera equipments, clothings etc.) smoothly and quietly that I almost at times forget I was pulling her. There was even one time when we had to push our bikes up a 18% gradient mountain pass and my young daughter just could not do it anymore that I placed her 8kg bike on top the load on the trailer and push it along just fine. It was a life saver. It was the single most important item during this trip and she performed superbly. I just want to give a shout out to the design team on this.
review.name: Korea Cross Country - Superb Performance

review.reviewBody: Have exceeded the weight limit (up to 80lbs) a few times. The frame flexes substantially but for short trips it can handle it. My wife doesn’t drive and has used this for nearly ten years as her primary errand runner thru northern New Mexico winters, dirt roads, hauling food for three dogs and 40 chickens. This trailer hasn’t needdd anything but tube replacements from the occasional goat head. We’re extremely impressed with it. If you’re on the fence, the ability to quickly detach it and use as a cart in the store is without doubt the game changer. Thanks for an awesome product, Burley!
review.name: Takes a beating. Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: Yhis is mt third travoy. I am happy with the fold out hand truck foot. I wrote to burley a few years ago about the need for a larger point if contact for stability on commuter trains . I love that it has this feature now.
review.name: Yhis is mt third travoy.

review.reviewBody: I am delighted with my recent purchase of a Burley Travoy cargo trailer. Last year I started carrying my golf clubs to the golf course on my bicycle in order to have a bit more exercise. However, carrying them over my shoulder was less than ideal. I am looking forward to using the Travoy to take the heavy burden this year. Additionally, I discovered that I can use the Travoy as my golf cart. Excellent dual duty.
review.name: Enjoy my new Travoy

review.reviewBody: The lower shelf would not lock. Burley immediately replaced my original with a new trailer that works perfectly. Truly top notch warranty service. As good as it gets. And I love my Travoy! Have used it for bikepacking with my Aventon ebike, and even fully loaded to the max, it has performed flawlessly.
review.name: Had an issue with my new Travoy

review.reviewBody: We are thrilled with our new trailer.We replaced our tandem with a new Co Motion and we’re aware we would be unable to use our Bob Trailer with our tandem the way it was built. (Axle) The way the Burley folds up is a huge benefit to us as we travel in a small RV.Our recent trip we were able to pickup propane ice and groceries using the trailer.(not in one trip) We need to purchase the optional bags soon. The trailer is so quiet while towing. Great design and engineering Burley. Best Always, Jarry and Brenda
review.name: We are thrilled with our

review.reviewBody: I am a landscape painter. This is my second Burley Travoy. My first survived 9 years of heavy use. I use the Travoy as a handcart. It carries my easel, paints, brushes and support gear cross country, up the trail, down the beach. It gives me the ability to head out far from my car without carrying everything on my back.
review.name: Painter’s Gear

review.reviewBody: Love this trailer. It’s perfect for biking around with my pickleball net!
review.name: Love this trailer. It’s perfect
